projects.title: Precision Irrigation with Federated Learning
projects.synopsis: Honours thesis combining decentralised AI with edge computing for sustainable agriculture. Developed a federated learning framework on Raspberry Pi devices to predict irrigation needs while preserving farmer data privacy.

caseStudy.challenge: Agriculture accounts for 70% of global freshwater consumption, yet 40% is wasted. Farmers hesitate to share sensitive crop data with central servers, and rural areas lack reliable internet for cloud-based AI.
caseStudy.solution: Built a custom Federated Learning framework from scratch. Used Raspberry Pi devices as edge nodes running MLP networks in PyTorch. Only anonymous model updates transmitted via SSH, keeping raw data local. Tested on Autonomous Greenhouse Challenge data for tomato production.
caseStudy.impact: Achieved R² of 0.6-0.7 for irrigation prediction, close to centralised baseline of 0.7-0.8, while guaranteeing 100% data privacy. Published findings with industry partner Accenture.

projects.title: Transaction Sentiment Analyser
projects.synopsis: Spring Boot application that analyses financial transaction descriptions for negative sentiment and automatically censors profanity. Built for Macquarie Coding Fest hackathon.

caseStudy.challenge: Banks need to monitor transaction data for compliance and improve customer experience by detecting inappropriate content in transaction descriptions.
caseStudy.solution: Built REST API endpoints to submit transactions for processing. Integrated Google Cloud Natural Language API for sentiment detection. Implemented automatic profanity censorship based on configurable bad_words.json. Used MongoDB for persistence and JMS for async processing.
caseStudy.impact: Demonstrated rapid prototyping skills at Macquarie Coding Fest 2023. Provided proof-of-concept for automated transaction monitoring.

projects.title: Scalable Image Annotation App
projects.synopsis: AWS cloud-native solution combining EC2 Auto Scaling with serverless Lambda functions. Users upload images and receive AI-generated captions via Gemini API integration.

caseStudy.challenge: Build a scalable, event-driven image processing pipeline that can handle variable load while demonstrating AWS architecture best practices.
caseStudy.solution: Implemented hybrid architecture: Flask web frontend on EC2 ASG behind ALB, with serverless Lambda functions triggered by S3 events via SNS. One Lambda generates Gemini API captions, another creates thumbnails. Complete IaC deployment via CloudFormation.
caseStudy.impact: Demonstrated expertise in AWS architecture, Infrastructure as Code, auto-scaling patterns, and generative AI integration.

projects.title: Tomato Leaf Disease Detection
projects.synopsis: Custom YOLO-11M object detection model for automated identification of 7 distinct tomato leaf diseases. Implemented Fourier-based regularization for sharper disease localization.

caseStudy.challenge: Manual crop inspection is time-consuming and error-prone. Need to identify 7 distinct leaf states including Bacterial Spot, Early Blight, and Late Blight with precise localization.
caseStudy.solution: Built custom YOLO-11M architecture with C2f Fusion Blocks (25% parameter reduction), SPPF for multi-scale pooling, and Polarized Self-Attention. Innovated with Fourier Loss term using 2D FFT to preserve high-frequency edge details.
caseStudy.impact: Fourier-enhanced model improved Box Precision by 2.4% and mAP@50 by 2.4% over baseline with zero inference overhead. Model focuses on disease textures rather than being distracted by shadows or dirt.

projects.title: Scholar Score
projects.synopsis: A Django web platform for university course reviews with sentiment analysis. Features secure university-email authentication, AJAX-driven infinite scroll, and dynamic sentiment coloring using NLP.

caseStudy.challenge: Students needed a trusted platform to share honest course reviews, but existing solutions lacked proper authentication and meaningful analysis of review sentiment.
caseStudy.solution: Built a full-stack Django application with Gmail API integration for secure university-email authentication. Integrated Google Cloud NLP to analyze and visualize review sentiment with color-coded indicators. Implemented AJAX-driven infinite scroll for seamless browsing.
caseStudy.impact: Achieved High Distinction (86) for the Internet Software Platforms course. Demonstrated full-stack capabilities and API integration skills.

projects.title: Smart Smoke Alarm ML Analysis
projects.synopsis: Machine learning research to modernize smoke alarm technology. Evaluated 5 algorithms on 60,000+ IoT observations to reduce false alarms while eliminating failures in detecting real fires.

caseStudy.challenge: Traditional smoke alarm technology unchanged since 1970s. In 2015, Australian false fire alarms were 97%, while ionisation alarms had 55% failure rate in real fires. This creates public complacency.
caseStudy.solution: Analyzed 60,000+ IoT observations including temperature, humidity, CO₂, and particle size. Tested 5 algorithms: KNN (weighted/unweighted), Naive Bayes (Multinomial/Gaussian), Logistic Regression, and MLP. Used Random Forest for feature selection and 70-30 cross-validation.
caseStudy.impact: Weighted KNN achieved 99.97% accuracy with only 0.04% false negative rate (missed 2 fires out of 15,000 tests). Neural network had dangerous 13.95% false negative rate. Findings suitable for industry pitch to Bosch, Honeywell, ABB.

projects.title: USYD ATAR Calculator Docker Migration
projects.synopsis: Technical consultancy for Faculty of Engineering Admissions. Containerized a mission-critical legacy ATAR calculator using Docker to resolve OS-compatibility issues.

caseStudy.challenge: Mission-critical legacy ATAR calculation tool was failing due to OS-compatibility issues during high-stakes admissions periods.
caseStudy.solution: Conducted stakeholder interviews to understand requirements and constraints. Used Docker to containerize the tool into a portable image that could run consistently across different operating systems.
caseStudy.impact: Provided 'heroic' relief to non-technical staff, ensuring operational continuity during critical admissions periods.

projects.title: Personal Finance Tracker
projects.synopsis: A privacy-first, local-first personal finance tracker built on AWS Serverless. Features idempotent CSV imports and handles specific bank schemas without sharing credentials.

caseStudy.challenge: Existing finance apps require sharing bank credentials or connecting via APIs—a privacy concern. Needed a way to track finances without trusting third parties with sensitive data.
caseStudy.solution: Built a serverless pipeline: S3 for CSV ingestion → Lambda for processing → DynamoDB with single-table design. Implemented idempotent re-import logic to handle duplicate uploads. Wrote parsers for specific Australian bank CSV schemas.
caseStudy.impact: Full control over personal financial data with zero credential sharing. Demonstrates single-table DynamoDB design and serverless architecture patterns.
